{"__typename":"RiskHazardsWithMethod","methodDescription":"Standard Procedure for Bunker line pressure testing","hazards":[{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Oil Spill","existingMeasures":"1. INITIAL PRESSURE TESTING TO BE CARRIED WITH AIR
2. THROUGH CHECK UP OF THE BUNKER LINE TO BE CARRIED OUT.
3. GRADUALLY INCREASE THE PRESSURE AND MONITOR THE LINE.
4. ONE PERSON STANDBY TO READY OPEN LINE BACK TO THE TANK IF ANY LEAKAGE AVAILABLE.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":5,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":4,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Overpressure on bunker line","existingMeasures":"1. LINE PRESSURE GAUGE WI;LL BE CALIBRATED BEFORE START THE JOB.
2. PRESSURE TO BE INCREASE GRADUALLY WHICH NOT SUDDENLY.
3. ONLY CALIBRATED LINE PRESSURE GAUGE WILL BE USED FOR READING THE PRESSURE ON THE LINE.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":5,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":4,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Personal Injury","existingMeasures":"1. TOOL BOX MEETING CARRIED OUT PRIOR START.
2. ALL PERSONNEL MYST BE AWARE OF WORKING  AREA CONDITION.
3. PPE MUST BE DONNED ACCORDING TO PPE MATRIX
4. ALL TOOLS MUST BE CHECKED PROPERLY BEFORE USE.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":5,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":4,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Loss of containment caused by hardware failure, overpressure or overflow resulting in environmental pollution, and/or injury and/or asset damage","existingMeasures":"Clear and detailed operating procedures established for all phases of the STS operation, including ramp up/down procedures during commencement - topping off and maximum loading rates.
Procedures define communication requirements, responsible  par ties and accountabilities for each phase of the operation.
Experienced personnel in Leadership positions in charge of Cargo operation.
Pre-transfer checks as per Checklists. Lines set up verified, Pressure monitored continuously manifolds, cargo tanks and IG system. Allowable Loading and Venting rates agreed upon prior cargo transfer and complied with.
Physical checking of all lines during commencement of cargo transfer.
Regular physical checks of ullages during cargo transfer.
Regular maintenance of pipelines and associated fittings to prevent heavy corrosion.
Routine Maintenance Schedule for all equipment, test procedures for cargo pipings complied. Overfill Alarm for each cargo tank is tested prior each operation.","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":5,"consequence":2,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":4,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":2,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null},{"__typename":"RiskHazard","identifiedHazard":"Presence of hazardous gases.","existingMeasures":"1. Work plan and tool box meeting,
2. Use of appropriate PPE.
3. Continuous ventilation
4. PGM to be carried by all personnels
5. DRA to be in place","additionalMeasures":null,"likelihood":3,"consequence":4,"likelihoodAfterExistingMeasures":2,"consequenceAfterExistingMeasures":4,"likelihoodAfterAdditionalMeasures":null,"consequenceAfterAdditionalMeasures":null}]}
